div.p: The Ludington Area School district, in partnership with parents and community, will educate and empower students to adapt and succeed in their futures.
Ludington Area School students will graduate from a top-performing district, confident in the skills required for their success in the global community.

hr.h3: Construction information for potential bidders on construction project
hr.p: If your company is interested in bidding on parts of the Ludington Area School District's upcoming construction projects please contact the Christman Company, specifically Ben Globke at: ben.globke@christmanco.com Ben has knowledge of the timing of the bidding categories and be able to provide the information that subcontractors will need. The bidding timeframe will be during the winter of 2020, construction will begin in Spring 2020, prior to bidding Christman will host a local subcontractor event to recruit and solicit contractors from the Ludington/Mason County area.

div.div: Use school network to update iPads

div.p: If you are using a hotspot at home or have spotty internet there are many spots around the schools where you can safely pull in, stay in your car, and use the school's network to complete the update to your student's iPad.

a.aria-label: Use school network to update iPads

div.p: Dear Parents, Guardians, Families, and Students:

While these are difficult and uncertain times, I hope that this message finds you making the most of this time with your family and that it has provided opportunities for you to connect with your children in ways that will build new and everlasting memories with one another. We must use this time to build connections, strengthen family and school relationships, and model grace and resilience.

We hope that this message finds you well. With the announcement from Governor Whitmer that ended face to face learning and closed school buildings for the remainder of the school year, Ludington High School will be open on Tuesday, April 14 from 8:00 am until 3:00 pm for parents / guardians to pick up iPads that are necessary for the remote learning process and / or pick up medications that were left in the Main Office.

div.div: Foster Student Items Pick Up Information

div.p: With the announcement from Governor Whitmer to close schools for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year, Foster Elementary will be open to parents on Monday, April 13th and Tuesday, April 14th to pick up their child’s school supplies, yearbooks, medications, etc.

a.aria-label: Foster Student Items Pick Up Information

div.p: We hope that your family is safe and doing well! While so many things have changed over the past month, one thing has not, we think about your child(ren) daily and look forward to supporting their continued growth as much as possible during these times.

div.div: Lakeview Student Item Pick Up Information

div.p: Let me start by saying how much I miss seeing your children each day. The direction we’ve taken is not one any of us could have imagined, but we look forward to seeing their smiling faces virtually in the coming weeks.

a.aria-label: Lakeview Student Item Pick Up Information

a.title: View more about State Mandated School Closure

div.div: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Governor Whitmer has made it mandatory for all schools in Michigan to close from March 16th through June 30th. See www.LASD.net for more information.
